Package com.saguaro.controller

Class GroceryController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.saguaro.controller.GroceryController
  • @RestController
@Validated
public class GroceryController
extends java.lang.Object
    REST controller defining endpoints related to grocery list management. The following endpoints are defined:
    • api/all-lists
    • api/list
    • api/create-list
    • api/save-list
    • api/delete-list
    Author:
    Charles Wong

      Constructs this grocery controller given a GroceryService.

      • GroceryController

        public GroceryController​(GroceryService groceryService)
        Constructs this grocery controller given a GroceryService.

        Notice that by default, Spring will attempt to autowire the only constructor of a class.

        Parameters:
        groceryService - a GroceryService to provide logic for this controller

    • Method Detail

      • getLists

        @GetMapping("api/all-lists")
public java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,​java.lang.String> getLists()
        Fetches all grocery lists for the currently authenticated user.

        Since this endpoint is a protected resource, a valid username must be available from the SecurityContext when this method is invoked.

        Returns:
        a Map from list IDs to list names

      • getList

        @GetMapping("api/list")
public GroceryList getList​(@RequestParam("id")
                           long id)
                    throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Fetch the details of a grocery list given a valid list ID. An invalid ID includes both IDs which do not exist, or IDs for which the corresponding list does not belong to the currently authenticated user. If such an ID is provided, a ResourceNotFoundException will be thrown.

        A successful fetch will return a GroceryList object, which in this context is simply a vehicle for the following information:

        • list ID
        • list name
        • grocery items

        Since this endpoint is a protected resource, a valid username must be available from the SecurityContext when this method is invoked.

        Parameters:
        id - the ID specifying the grocery list to fetch
        Returns:
        a GroceryList object which can be deserialized
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the provided list ID is invalid

      • createNewList

        @PostMapping("api/create-list")
public GroceryList createNewList​(@RequestParam("name")
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 @RequestParam(value="template",required=false,defaultValue="false")
                                 boolean template,
                                 @RequestParam(value="templateId",required=false)
                                 java.lang.Long templateId)
                          throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Create a new grocery list with the given name. Optionally mark the grocery list as a template, or initialize the grocery list with the items from an existing template. Note that these are mutually exclusive, with marking as template having precedence: if a grocery list is marked as a template, it will not be initialized with an existing template, regardless of if that argument is provided.

        Returns a GroceryList object, which in this context is simply a vehicle for the following information:

        • list ID
        • list name
        • grocery items
        Parameters:
        name - the String to set the new grocery list's name to
        template - a boolean specifying if the created list should be a grocery list template
        templateId - a Long object representing the ID of the template to initialize the new list with
        Returns:
        the newly created GroceryList object
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if attempting to create a list using the provided template ID fails

      • saveList

        @PutMapping("api/save-list")
public GroceryList saveList​(@Validated @RequestBody
                            GroceryList list)
                     throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Given some valid GroceryList object, saves the object as the new state of the list. The grocery list to be overwritten is identified by the list ID. The name attribute may be null, in which case the list's name will remain unchanged.

        If the provided list has an ID which does not exist, or the currently authenticated user does not own or have shared access to the list corresponding to the ID, a ResourceNotFoundException is thrown.

        If the save is successful, then the newly saved grocery list is returned.

        Since this endpoint is a protected resource, a valid username must be available from the SecurityContext when this method is invoked.

        Parameters:
        list - the GroceryList to save
        Returns:
        the newly saved GroceryList
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the provided GroceryList contains an invalid ID

      • editListName

        @PutMapping("api/edit-list-name")
public GroceryList editListName​(@RequestParam("name") @NotBlank
                                @NotBlank java.lang.String name,
                                @RequestParam("id")
                                long id)
                         throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Edit the name of some existing grocery list. The grocery list to edit is specified by a long representing an ID, and a non-blank new name must be provided.

        If the provided list ID does not match any grocery list belonging to the currently authenticated user, a ResourceNotFoundException is thrown.

        If the edit is successful, the newly modified grocery list is returned.

        Parameters:
        name - the String to set the list name to
        id - a long representing the ID of the grocery list to edit
        Returns:
        the newly modified GroceryList
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the provided list ID does not match any grocery list belonging to the currently authenticated user

      • deleteList

        @DeleteMapping("api/delete-list")
@ResponseStatus(NO_CONTENT)
public void deleteList​(@RequestParam("id")
                       long id)
                throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Given a valid list ID, delete the corresponding list. An invalid ID includes both IDs which do not exist, or IDs for which the corresponding list does not belong to the currently authenticated user. If such an ID is provided, a ResourceNotFoundException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the list to delete
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the provided list ID is invalid

      • getAllListsFull

        @GetMapping("api/v2/all-lists")
public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getAllListsFull()
        Fetch a comprehensive list of all the grocery lists the authenticated user has access to.

        The returned JSON object has two top level properties:

        • lists
        • templates

        The values of these are objects with the following two properties:

        • owned
        • shared

        These properties correspond to an object mapping list ID to list name, of lists that the authenticated user owns and has shared access to, respectively.

        Returns:
        a Map object describing all lists the authenticated user has access to

      • shareList

        @PostMapping("api/share-list")
public GroceryList shareList​(@RequestParam("id")
                             long id,
                             @RequestParam("username")
                             java.lang.String shareUsername)
                      throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Add a user to the shared users of a grocery list. A list can only be shared by the owner of the list, and if the user it is being shared with is a friend of the owner. If any of these conditions are not met, then a ResourceNotFoundException is thrown.

        Furthermore, if the user to be shared with cannot be found, or if the list ID does not match any existing list, a ResourceNotFoundException is thrown.

        Since this endpoint is a protected resource, a valid username must be available from the SecurityContext when this method is invoked.

        If the sharing was successful, the newly modified GroceryList object is returned.

        Parameters:
        id - a long representing the ID of the GroceryList to share
        shareUsername - the String username of the user to share the list with
        Returns:
        the newly modified GroceryList object
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the list to be shared does not belong to the sharer, or if the sharee is not a friend of the sharer

      • unshareList

        @DeleteMapping("api/unshare-list")
public GroceryList unshareList​(@RequestParam("id")
                               long id,
                               @RequestParam("username")
                               java.lang.String shareUsername)
                        throws ResourceNotFoundException
        Remove a user from the shared users of a grocery list. This operation can only be performed by the owner of a list. In addition, only users that the list is already shared with can be "unshared" from a list. If the above conditions are not met, then a ResourceNotFoundException will be thrown, with an appropriate error message.

        If the removal was successful, the newly modified GroceryList object is returned.

        Parameters:
        id - a long representing the ID of the GroceryList to unshare
        shareUsername - the String username of the user to unshare the list with
        Returns:
        the newly modified GroceryList object
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the list to be unshared does not belong to the authenticated user, or if the user to be unshared was not part of the shared users of the list
